titleStmt.title: The fanaticks barber. Or, A new cut for non-conformists. Being a true relation of the parson that was lately gelt at Chemsford in Essex, being taken in bed with another mans wife. Very proper to be sung in all corporations of this nation. All the town shan't save thee.

notesStmt.note: Verse: "O women, you that can so well ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
In this edition, the title word "Barber" is followed by a raised period.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
